00022    template <typename Data>
00023    class DMatrix : public Matrix<Data>
00024    {
00025 
00026       using Matrix<Data>::data_;
00027       using Matrix<Data>::capacity1_;
00028       using Matrix<Data>::capacity2_;
00029 
00030    public:
00031 
00035       DMatrix();

00080    // Method definitions
00081 
00082    /*
00083    * Default constructor.
00084    */
00085    template <typename Data>
00086    DMatrix<Data>::DMatrix() :
00087       Matrix<Data>()
00088    {}
00089       
00090    /*
00091    * Copy constructor.
00092    */
00093    template <typename Data>
00094    DMatrix<Data>::DMatrix(const DMatrix<Data>& other) 
00095      : Matrix<Data>()
00096    {
00097 
00098       // Precondition
00099       if (other.data_ == 0) {
00100          UTIL_THROW("Other DMatrix must be allocated");
00101       }
00102 
00103       allocate(other.capacity1_, other.capacity2_);
00104 
00105       // Copy elements
00106       for (int i = 0; i < capacity1_*capacity2_; ++i) {
00107          data_[i] = other.data_[i];
00108       }
00109    }
00110    
00111    /*
00112    * Assignment.
00113    */
00114    template <typename Data>
00115    DMatrix<Data>& DMatrix<Data>::operator = (const DMatrix<Data>& other) 
00116    {
00117 
00118       // Check for self assignment.
00119       if (this == &other) return *this;
00120 
00121       // Precondition
00122       if (other.data_ == 0) {
00123          UTIL_THROW("RHS DMatrix must be allocated in assignment");
00124       }
00125 
00126       // If this this DMatrix if not allocated, allocate now.
00127       // If this this DMatrix is allocated, check that capacities are equal.
00128       if (data_ == 0) {
00129          allocate(other.capacity1_, other.capacity2_);
00130       } else {
00131          if (capacity1_ != other.capacity1_ || 
00132              capacity2_ != other.capacity2_) {
00133             UTIL_THROW("Unequal capacities in assignment");
00134          }
00135       }
00136 
00137       // Copy elements
00138       for (int i = 0; i < capacity1_*capacity2_; ++i) {
00139          data_[i] = other.data_[i];
00140       }
00141 
00142       return *this;
00143    }
00144 
00145    /*
00146    * Destructor.
00147    *
00148    * Delete dynamically allocated C array.
00149    */
00150    template <typename Data>
00151    DMatrix<Data>::~DMatrix()
00152    {
00153       if (data_ != 0) {
00154          delete [] data_;
00155          data_ = 0;
00156       }
00157    }
00158 
00159    /*
00160    * Allocate memory for a matrix.
00161    *
00162    * \param capacity1 number of rows (range of first index)
00163    * \param capacity2 number of columns (range of second index)
00164    */
00165    template <typename Data>
00166    void DMatrix<Data>::allocate(int capacity1, int capacity2)
00167    {
00168 
00169       // Preconditions
00170       if (capacity1 <= 0) UTIL_THROW("Capacity1 must be positive");
00171       if (capacity2 <= 0) UTIL_THROW("Capacity2 must be positive");
00172       if (data_     != 0) UTIL_THROW("Attempt to re-allocate a Matrix");
00173 
00174       data_      = new Data[capacity1*capacity2];
00175       capacity1_ = capacity1;
00176       capacity2_ = capacity2;
00177    }
00178 
00179    /*
00180    * Serialize a DMatrix to/from an Archive.
00181    */
00182    template <class Data>
00183    template <class Archive>
00184    void DMatrix<Data>::serialize(Archive& ar, const unsigned int version)
00185    {
00186       int capacity1, capacity2;
00187       if (Archive::is_saving()) {
00188          capacity1 = capacity1_;
00189          capacity2 = capacity2_;
00190       }
00191       ar & capacity1;
00192       ar & capacity2;
00193       if (Archive::is_loading()) {
00194          if (!isAllocated()) {
00195             if (capacity1 > 0 && capacity2 > 0) {
00196                allocate(capacity1, capacity2);
00197             }
00198          } else {
00199             if (capacity1 != capacity1_) {
00200                UTIL_THROW("Inconsistent DMatrix capacity1 values");
00201             }
00202             if (capacity2 != capacity2_) {
00203                UTIL_THROW("Inconsistent DMatrix capacity2 values");
00204             }
00205          }
00206       }
00207       for (int i = 0; i < capacity1_*capacity2_; ++i) {
00208          ar & data_[i];
00209       }
00210    }
00211 
00213    template <class Data>
00214    inline bool DMatrix<Data>::isAllocated() const 
00215    {  return !(data_ == 0); }
00216 
00217 }
